ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: As recompense for what they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As recompense for all they had done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: All this shall be theirs as a reward for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The reward for what they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: A reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: a recompense for that they laboured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: shall be their recompense for their deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: A recompense for that which they have been working.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: A reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: a recompense for all that they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As a reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As reward for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:24] a reward (jazā’an is an object denoting reason or a verbal noun, with the operator being an implicit [verb], in other words, ‘We have appointed for them the mentioned as a reward’ or ‘We have rewarded them [this]’) for what they used to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Reward) this is a reward for the inhabitants of the Garden (for what they used do) and say of good things in the life of the world.
